title: Fullstack Software Engineer
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 DICE is a creative studio with offices in Stockholm and Gothenburg. We believe in the power of diversity and welcome game creators from all backgrounds to collaborate with us as we unlock the potential for the future of Battlefield!
   

  

 We're always pushing to be at the forefront of creative entertainment - blending digital art, design, and technology to push boundaries. Our collaborative culture is fueled by passion, driving innovation and making a positive difference for our players and community.
   

  

 At DICE, your ideas matter. We offer an inclusive space where you can thrive, be yourself, and grow alongside a team dedicated to making a meaningful impact to the world of gaming.
   

  

 We're all-in on the future and our most ambitious Battlefield yet. Want to be part of something special? Read on.
   

  

**The Role**
 We believe that to provide the best possible experience for our players we need the best tools possible!
   

  

 As a
 *Fullstack Engineer* 
 at Foundational Tech(FT) Online, you will design, implement and maintain internal web-based tools that will be used by our Live team to engage with millions of our players across the globe, dynamically changing the gameplay experience, progression, in-game store, matchmaking and many other aspects of our games. You will report into a
 *Development Director* 
 .
   

  

 FT Online works in small teams that collaborate to create online solutions for our games, using modern technologies and frameworks deployed to a cloud-based infrastructure. You will integrate with multiple existing systems; some developed in-house and some by external parties. You will work with many different teams within EA.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Collaborate with stakeholders (e.g. game design, UX, product and analytics teams) to identify and fulfill online game design needs
* Analyze, design, specify and implement game design features/solutions
* Work in an agile engineering team - writing well designed, testable, maintainable and scalable code
* Be part of technical architecture discussions and help guide technical decisions within the team
* Drive continuous improvement of software quality, customer experience, and maintainability of products/features


**Requirements**
* 5+ years of experience in TypeScript, including an understanding of concepts like closures, asynchronous programming, state management and dependency injection patterns
* 5+ years of experience working on web projects applying modern web development best practices, from UI in the front-end to micro-services and cloud services in the back end
* Experience with continuous integration and delivery
* Experience developing distributed, resilient, and scalable back-end systems using Scala, Java, or other JVM language
* Write clear / concise maintainable, testable (unit & integration testing) code


**Nice To Have**
* Experience with React and Mobx.
* Experience with Kubernetes or other container-orchestration systems.
* Experience with cloud services.
* Experience with functional languages (e.g. Scala)
* Contributions to Open-Source projects.


**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We take a holistic approach with our benefits program, focusing on physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life with paid time off and new parent leave, plus free games and so much more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: Software Engineer - Engineering Productivity
description:
**Help Shape the Future of Development at Nordnet: Join Our Engineering Productivity Team!**
 Innovation and empowering our developers are at the heart of Nordnet's engineering culture. We operate with a modern, microservices-based architecture featuring highly available and scalable backend applications, alongside advanced CI/CD and data pipelines built on technologies like Java, Spring Boot, PubSub, and Kubernetes. Our commitment to continuous delivery means we release to production over 100 times a day.
   

  

 We're looking for a passionate Software Engineer to join Nordnet's Engineering department and our dedicated
 **Engineering Productivity team** 
 . In this team you'll be improving the developer experience across the Engineering organization. Our team acts as an internal catalyst, focused on making our developers more efficient, informed, and successful.
   

  

**Your daily work will involve**
* Building and supporting our "Know Your Maintenance" framework: Empowering development teams with crucial technical insights for proactive maintenance.
* Developing tools and visualizations for complex migrations: Making large-scale changes smoother and more transparent for everyone involved.
* Creating and maintaining shared tooling, such as custom linters: Simplifying common development tasks and promoting best practices across teams.
* Identifying and addressing pain points in the developer workflow: Proactively seeking opportunities to improve efficiency and reduce friction.
* Collaborating and communicating closely with other development teams: Understanding their needs and building solutions that truly make a difference.
* Maintaining and evolving our internal developer portal based on Backstage: Ensuring it's a valuable and user-friendly hub for developers.


**This is you**
 You are a software engineer who thrives on solving challenges and empowering others. You're driven to learn new technologies and share your knowledge and passion. Your work style is organized, methodical, and adaptable, contributing positively to the team's dynamics and our ability to deliver impactful solutions.
   

  

 You bring previous experience in software engineering in a cloud-based environment. You have a natural curiosity for technology and a knack for selecting the right tools for the job. You also enjoy communicating your ideas clearly and collaborating effectively with others. An MSc degree in Computing/Engineering or equivalent is preferred, and familiarity with agile methodologies is essential. While experience and interest in savings and investments is a plus, it's not a requirement – your passion for developer productivity is what truly matters.
   

  

**As An Engineer On Our Team, You Are**
* A strong communicator, transparent in your work, and an active listener.
* Results-oriented, valuing data and outcomes over ego.
* A continuous learner, always seeking opportunities for growth.
* Passionate about automation and streamlining processes.
* Contributing to a positive and productive developer experience.


**You Have Experience In**
* Designing, building, and maintaining scalable and reliable systems.
* Modern software engineering principles and practices.
* Working with containerization and orchestration technologies.
* Implementing solutions for technical insights and data analysis.


**Concrete Qualifications**
* MSc degree in Computer Science or equivalent with more than 3 years experience working in an agile environment
* Experience in one or more of the following languages: TypeScript, Java, Golang
* Experience in building infrastructure using Terraform and similar technologies
* Experience with at least one of the big cloud providers
* Experience in GCP, BigQuery and VertexAI is meriting but not required.


**Culture At Nordnet Engineering**
* A just-do-it attitude, where everyone feels enabled and valued, regardless of their position or role.
* We live and breathe technology taking pride in our work
* We take a scientific approach by experimenting and learning
* We are curious and respectful, listen and ask questions with the intent to understand, while embracing different perspectives
* We assume positive intent in others and foster a culture where speaking up and challenging ideas is welcomed.
* A commitment to work-life balance, ensuring flexibility and support for our employees’ well-being.


**This is us**
 At Nordnet, technology is at the core of everything we do, driving innovation and maintaining our competitive edge. We’ve made over 30 000 production releases this year, releasing our web every other hour and our app every two days.
   

  

 We offer you the opportunity to work in a Nordic environment with a strong focus
   

  

 on delivery, product development and technology. Our ambitions are high and
   

  

 you will embark on a fast and challenging journey together with a skillful team of
   

  

 sharp and committed colleagues.
   

  

 Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having
   

  

 a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly
   

  

 atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts
   

  

 and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values –
   

  

 passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what
   

  

 you do.
   

  

 29 years ago, Nordnet redefined the financial world as the first digital bank in Europe. Now we are about to do it again with the aim of creating the next generation of bank, in the cloud. We know that this requires great people, great teams, and great technology.
   

  

 Do you want to join us and build the new Nordnet?
   

  

**Application**
 Apply today! – Please note that we only accept applications through our recruitment system. We do not consider email applications.
   

  

 At Nordnet, we value diversity and inclusion, and we are committed to creating an environment where everyone can succeed.
   

  

 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Software Engineer - AI Team | Stockholm
description:
*Are you a skilled Software Developer with expertise in .NET, SQL, and Python? Do you have a passion for building low-latency applications and a knack for A/B testing, end-to-end testing, and monitoring? Are you excited about bridging AI and real-world applications to solve meaningful problems? Join Apotea’s Data and AI team and help us transform e-commerce and digital healthcare through innovative AI and ML solutions!*
**AI + Apotea =**
 Apotea is Sweden’s leading online pharmacy, committed to making healthcare accessible and efficient for everyone. Our Data and AI team is at the heart of innovation, building AI and ML applications that enhance customer experience, streamline operations, and create a foundation for future innovations. By following industry best practices, we develop modern data and AI architectures that deliver value to both the business and our customers.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a Software Developer in the Data and AI team, you will but not limited to:
   

  

* Design, develop, and maintain high-performance, low-latency applications using .NET, SQL, and Python.
* Conduct A/B testing and end-to-end testing to ensure system reliability and optimize performance.
* Implement and optimize data collection mechanisms on the website to ensure accurate and efficient data capture.
* Implement robust monitoring solutions to proactively detect and resolve issues.
* Collaborate with data engineers, ML engineers, and cross-functional teams to build AI-driven solutions that solve real-world problems.
* Contribute to the development of modern data and AI architectures, ensuring scalability and alignment with industry best practices.
* Play a key role in improving customer experience and operational efficiency through innovative technology.


**Who You Are**
 We think you are a problem-solver with a focus on delivering high-quality, impactful solutions. You are an collaborative team player who can also work independently and have a passionate about learning more about data, AI, and ML, and eager to work closely with experts in these fields and you also have:
   

  

* Proficient in .NET, SQL, and Python, with a strong understanding of software development principles.
* Experienced in A/B testing, end-to-end testing, and monitoring.
* Skilled in building low-latency, high-performance applications.
* Experienced in implementing data collection mechanisms on websites (e.g., tracking user interactions, event logging, and data pipelines).
* Skilled in data modeling, with the ability to design and maintain structured, efficient, and scalable data models.
* Familiar with software architecture principles and capable of making critical tradeoffs in design and implementation.
* Experienced or interested in working with recommendation and search systems (a plus).


**Bonus Points If You Have**
* Experience with cloud platforms like Azure or AWS.
* Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.
* Familiarity with frontend technologies.
* Experience in e-commerce, logistics, or healthcare systems.


**What Apotea Offer You**
* The chance to work on cutting-edge AI and ML projects that impact millions of customers.
* Join a flat, agile organization with minimal bureaucracy
* Drive sustainability through eco-friendly packaging and logistics
* Opportunities for career growth through training, mentorship, and industry conferences.
* Collaborate in a cross-functional, transparent environment
* Own projects from concept to deployment
* A stable, future-focused company with a meaningful mission to improve healthcare accessibility.


**About Apotea**
 Apotea.se is Sweden’s largest online pharmacy, with the country’s broadest range of over 32,000 non-prescription items and nearly 19,000 prescription drugs for humans and animals. Recognized as Sweden’s most sustainable e-commerce company (Sustainable Brand Index 2021), we simplify everyday life for our customers with fast deliveries and expert advice. In 2024, Apotea reached a turnover of SEK 6.5 billion and currently employs about 1,000 people across Stockholm, Lidingö, and Morgongåva.
   

  

 Apotea is an inclusive employer that values diversity. We welcome all applicants and strive to create a work environment where people, regardless of background, gender, age, religion, or disability, can thrive and grow.
   

  

**The process**
* Apply
* Interview 1: Culture fit
* Interview 2: Technical skills
* Background check: As a pharmacy, we always conduct a background check.
* Potential job offer


**Join Us and Make a Difference -** 
**We hope you want to be a part of our team!**
 Submit your application today—interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis, and the position may be filled immediately. Start date by agreement.
   

  

*Welcome to Apotea – where technology meets health and creates magic!*
 Apotea är Sveriges största nätapotek med fokus på hållbarhet och snabba leveranser. Vår logistik är hjärtat i verksamheten, och vi har som mål att bli Nordens största apotek och Sveriges mest hållbara företag. Tillsammans med våra kunder har vi samlat in över 100 miljoner kronor till välgörenhet, och vi fortsätter att växa varje år – med våra medarbetare som den drivande kraften bakom framgången.

title: Full-Stack Developer - Node.js React GCloud
description:
**LEIA Health** 




 LEIA Health is a startup based in Stockholm with the vision to reinvent maternal and postpartum health for the digital age. Helping the next 1B parents on a happier and healthier entry into parenthood.
 



 We build a parental support solution to help companies increase wellbeing in the workforce by driving productivity and retention. In combination with our postpartum health tracker we offer new parents all information they need in one place, personalised insights into their mental and physical health and recovery plans based on their birth experience. With screening models for postpartum depression and pelvic floor complications, LEIA identifies women at risk already before their appointment with a midwife.
 



**About your role** 




 At LEIA, you would join our product development team as part of the main LEIA Group. Our team focuses on building new Features for our health app, experiment with our UX and user base, A/B testing, building new functionality for upcoming initiatives and improving ways of working. We are believers in teamwork, pair/mob programming and sharing knowledge.
 



 Our current stack includes Typescript, React, React-Native, Node.js and our infra runs in GCP.
 



**What You'll Bring to the Team** 




 As a Software Engineer at LEIA, you'll be a passionate team player and a driving force behind enhancing our engineering practices. You'll collaborate closely with your colleagues, guiding them through the establishment of standards and promoting best practices. Your role will be pivotal in shaping our culture and ways of working, where we embrace agile development, pair programming, and continuous learning.
 



 Your contributions will revolve around:
 


* Developing highly available and resilient modern cloud-based systems that deliver exceptional user experiences.
* Fostering a collaborative environment where you'll be an integral part of the team, contributing to our culture and agile methodologies.
* Enabling continuous deployment, ensuring seamless code releases over time.
* Embracing a growth mindset, where failures are seen as opportunities to learn and propel us towards our next breakthrough, alongside talented colleagues.
* Leveraging modern tools and languages that excite you and drive innovation.



**What You Should Have** 



* Proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript and Node.js, with the ability to write clean, testable code.
* Experience with common JavaScript libraries and frameworks, particularly React and hopefully React Native.
* Proven track record in product development, and microservices architecture.
* Hands-on experience with Agile practices and Code Testing, such as Continuous Integration, or Continuous Delivery.



 At LEIA, we believe that our mission to reinvent maternal and postpartum health for the digital age starts with creating an inclusive and diverse environment. We are committed to simplifying the lives of new parents by offering innovative solutions that cater to their unique needs and experiences. Our team reflects the diversity of the families we serve, fostering a culture where different perspectives, backgrounds, and identities are valued and celebrated. We strive to create a supportive and empowering workplace that enables every individual to thrive, regardless of their race, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, or parental status.
 



**What we offer** 



* Opportunity to engage, strengthen and support extraordinary parents across the world.
* A key role in growing an early stage team where you’ll build both the product and the business.
* Experience building a global tech startup from an early stage.
* Be a part of a global expansion, where moving into new markets will present new exciting possibilities to connect with local communities and grow both personally and professionally.
* We are an organization committed to creating and maintaining an inspiring workplace where everyone loves to go to work.
* 30 days vacation per year.
* Wellness benefit of 3000 SEK per year.
* Parental Leave Benefits.

title: Full Stack Developer with scrum master role in the Connectivity & API Department | SEB, Solna
description:
At SEB, technology fuels our mission to deliver world-class financial services across 20 global sites. Join a team of over 2800 innovators shaping the future of finance by blending cutting-edge technology with the dynamic world of global markets. Here, your work will influence financial flows, enabling us to deliver exceptional client experiences through robust systems, advanced AI, and a forward-thinking tech stack.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Full Stack Developer with scrum master responsibilities in the Connectivity & API department, you’ll play a vital role in building SEB's API-driven platform and governance. While sometimes contributing to the frontend development and filling the scrum master role in the team, you’ll be taking the lead and focusing on the development of microservices and governance of APIs in our API gateway, a highly prioritized area, to ensure seamless and engaging user experiences for our customers and internal teams.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities Include**
* Writing efficient, well-structured Golang based microservice and APIs with robust unit tests.
* Conducting code reviews and ensuring best practices.
* Conduct agile practices and ensure the team's agile alignment, values and practices
* Supporting team objectives and fostering collaboration throughout the entire area of the team and its tech stack.
* Writing and improving Angular based codebases for our customer facing portal.
* Participating in support and On Call duties as part of the team.


**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Backend skills: 5+ years with languages like Go, C#, or Java.
* Scrum master skills: Experience and a strong interest in agile way of working.
* Frontend expertise: 2+ years with modern frameworks like Angular or similar.
* A solid grasp and interest of design patterns, agile development methodologies and the Scrum master role.
* Proficiency in English and Swedish (written and spoken).
* Experience working in complex technical environments requiring strong communication and problem-solving skills.
* A passion for innovation and a solution-oriented mindset.


**Bonus Points For Experience With**
* DevOps and Continuous Delivery (e.g., Kubernetes, GitHub Actions).
* Microservices architecture and REST APIs.


**What We Offer**
* Opportunities to contribute to SEB’s top-priority initiatives.
* A collaborative, friendly, and welcoming culture.
* Diverse, international teams in a global working environment.
* Competitive compensation with exclusive SEB staff banking benefits.
* A modern hybrid work model and state-of-the-art office spaces.


**Learn more about working at SEB** 
**www.sebgroup.com/career**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

**Ready to join?**
 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 20th of May. If you have questions about the position please contact Anton Hänni, Talent acquisition Partner at anton.hanni@seb.se.
   

  

 SEB is one of the largest Tech employers in the Nordics. We are international, business savvy techies that contribute to or are responsible for SEB’s banking software, ensuring that both internal and external products and services are delivered fast and efficiently, that access is always on, and that solutions are trusted and compliant. We work hard to future-proof SEB with world class digital architecture and the deployment of new technologies. Read more: https://sebgroup.com/

title: Senior Backend Developer
description:
**What We Do**
 At Helicon, we build digital products that matter. As a digital product development & innovation agency specializing in cleantech, we partner with forward-thinking businesses to build breakthrough digital products, platforms, and capabilities that drive sustainability and efficiency.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 Our journey has taken us from developing one of Sweden’s largest virtual power plants by connecting over 15,000 buildings, to using AI to optimize energy, water, and resource management around the world. We have also helped launch award-winning cleantech startups and SaaS solutions for the energy sector.
   

  

 But we don’t just measure success by the impact we have on our customers. We measure it by the real-world sustainability gains our solutions create. When our customers tell us that our solutions helped shut down a coal and oil power plant, integrate more renewables into their portfolio, or cut 36,000 tons of CO₂ emissions annually, we take immense pride in that.
   

  

 What truly drives us is our passion for solving complex challenges together by combining strategy, design, engineering, and data science. At Helicon, speed, curiosity, collaboration, and continuous learning are at the heart of everything we do. If you’re passionate about technology and in using it to make a positive impact on our planet, you’ll fit right in with our team.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a backend engineer, you will mainly focus on the backend but help out on the frontend side when needed by collaborating with colleagues on the same project. You'll have a significant technical and organizational impact, driving both solutions and long-term innovative initiatives. You will be involved in the entire product-building journey, from design and development to testing and implementation. It will be fast-paced, challenging, and rewarding.
   

  

**What you’ll do;**
* You will typically focus more on the backend stack of a specific project, but there are projects where support on both sides is needed, and front-end focus may shift between projects
* Provide mentoring and drive the team forward in terms of development methodologies
* Rapidly and precisely plan and execute application development projects
* Understand customer’s needs to help define requirements
* Perform constructive code reviews and provide meaningful feedback
* Build and lead development teams and initiatives


**What you’ll bring to the table;**
* 5+ years of experience with a reasonably up-to-date backend stack, preferably with Python, along with some experience in frontend development
* Experience with running deployments on AWS and/or Azure
* Strong understanding of Docker and Git
* Fundamental understanding of profiling and performance optimization
* Ability to build applications that can handle large amounts of data while remaining highly responsive
* Strong opinions on how to best connect applications with external APIs
* Able to work in a hybrid setup in Stockholm and fluent in Swedish and English


**What We Offer**
 At Helicon, you can expect to work alongside truly tech-passionate people every day. What we do has a big impact on building a more efficient future, which gives us pride in our work. We foster a culture of humble collaboration, where we are always eager to learn and innovate. We prioritize balance between your job and private life and regularly host social activities like hackathons, after-work gatherings, yearly conferences, shuffleboard comps, and more!
   

  

**Application**
 Even if you do not meet all the requirements, we encourage you to apply, as our number one priority is to hire the right people instead of nitty-gritty tech.
   

  

 Our recruitment process usually consists of a first interview, a technical step followed by a business and culture-focused interview.
   

  

 At Helicon, we build digital products that matter. As a digital product development & innovation agency specializing in CleanTech, we partner with forward-thinking businesses to build breakthrough digital products, platforms, and capabilities that drive sustainability and efficiency.
   

  

 Our journey has taken us from developing one of Sweden’s largest virtual power plants by connecting over 15,000 buildings, to using AI to optimize energy, water, and resource management around the world. We have also helped launch award-winning CleanTech startups and SaaS solutions for the energy sector.
   

  

 But we don’t just measure success by the impact we have on our customers. We measure it by the real-world sustainability gains our solutions create. When our customers tell us that our solutions helped shut down a coal and oil power plant, integrate more renewables into their portfolio, or cut 36,000 tons of CO₂ emissions annually, we take immense pride in that.
   

  

 What truly drives us is our passion for solving complex challenges together by combining strategy, design, engineering, and data science. At Helicon, speed, curiosity, collaboration, and continuous learning are at the heart of everything we do. If you’re passionate about technology and using it to make a positive impact on our planet, you’ll fit right in with our team.

title: Senior Backend Software Engineer - Stockholm
description:
**What You Will Do**
 As a Senior Software Engineer at Brite you will work with our core team of highly skilled developers. Your tasks will be to develop and build a scalable and future-proof framework. You will work on building components to bridge between us and the banks across Europe, in order to deliver authentication (AIS) and payment initiation (PIS). As a Developer at Brite, you will have a major impact on building the foundation of our core platform. With that said, you will be a vital part of the next fintech unicorn!
   

  

**Why join Brite?**
* Supportive Team: Collaborate with skilled colleagues who are passionate about success and teamwork.
* Make an Impact: Contribute in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where ideas matter, and growth is fueled by shared learning.
* Flexibility: Hybrid work model with an office in central Stockholm.
* Career Growth: We support professional development and career advancement.


**Are you a brite mind?**
* Experience in systems development in Python
* Experience with Cloud Computing (Google cloud)
* At least 3 years of developer work experience


**Meriting experience:**
* AWS, Azure
* Kubernetes
* Microservice architecture
* GO or React


**Preferred skills:**
* A degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience
* Experience from building scalable, service-oriented architectures
* Experience from working with transaction-intensive systems
* Experience with Docker
* Experience with Javascript/Typescript
* Experience with information security from a systems development perspective (OWASP, encryption, etc.)


**About Brite**
 Founded in 2019, Brite Payments is a leading open banking-powered account-to-account (A2A) payment provider of instant payments, payouts, and other financial services in Europe. Brite is committed to creating fast, secure, and transparent payment solutions that reduce risk for businesses and provide consumers with the best possible payment experience.
   

  

 At the heart of Brite is our proprietary instant payments network, Brite IPN, which enables real-time, 24/7 transaction processing with no delays, sign-ups, or card details required. Today, Brite connects with over 3,800 banks in 27 European markets and is committed to delivering cutting-edge, next-generation payment solutions that meet the market’s evolving needs.
   

  

 Headquartered in Stockholm, Brite has offices in London and Malaga and now numbers over 170+ colleagues.
   

  

 Want to join us on our journey? The future is Brite!

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere by Rethinking IT. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons, while shaping the future of connectivity.
   

  

**We are currently looking for highly skilled Senior Frontend Developer for various teams in Stockholm, Sweden.**
***Please note that applicants must live in Sweden and hold a valid work permit at the time of application to be considered for this role.***
**Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain highly reliable and scalable web services and UIs that serve millions of users worldwide (e.g. UniFi Network, Site Manager, Community or online store)
* Collaborate with developers and designers in distributed teams in an agile and fast-paced, international work environment
* Actively participate in projects and voice your ideas and solutions
* Maintain industry-standard programming style and stay up-to-date with the latest technologies and trends


**Requirements**
* Extensive experience of coding in modern JavaScript, TypeScript and Node.js
* Very good knowledge of front-end libraries such as React.js
* Good knowledge of programming design patterns and web protocols
* Experience of debugging, profiling and optimising web apps
* Strong sense of ownership of tasks and responsibilities
* Ability to lead yourself and your own work as well as collaborate extensively with others
* Familiar with Git and Jira
* Excellent communication skills and highly proficient in English (written and spoken)


**Nice To Have**
* Experience with WebRTC and WebSockets
* BSc degree in Computer Science, or related engineering degree


**Benefits**
* International work environment
* Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance
* Five weeks of holiday per year
* Flexible work hours and hybrid work model
* Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
* Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
**About the Company** 




 Disruptive Novotech is at the forefront of innovation in wearable neuromodulation medical devices. As a dynamic and fast-growing start-up, the company is passionate about improving healthcare through cutting-edge technology. Join the team and help redefine the future of electro-stimulation.
 



  





**About the Position** 




 Are you a Frontend Developer passionate about building beautiful, fast, and user-friendly applications? We are looking for someone to take ownership of our frontend and be involved from the start in developing a premium product.
 



 Your key responsibilities:
 


* Develop and optimize mobile applications for both iOS and Android.
* Build a scalable and efficient frontend system that delivers a premium experience.
* Work closely with UI designers and backend developers.
* Ensure the applications load quickly, are bug-free, and provide a top-tier user experience.
* Contribute to decisions on frameworks and technical solutions.



  





**Qualifications and Characteristics** 




 The ideal candidate has experience developing frontend solutions for mobile and web apps, with a strong focus on systematization and performance. You are skilled in cross-platform development for Android and Apple, understand animations and complex performance optimizations, and take pride in delivering high-quality, efficient, and well-structured applications.
 



  





**We are looking for someone who:** 



* Has at least 5 years of frontend development experience, preferably focused on mobile apps.
* Has a university degree in Computer Science or equivalent.
* Has experience developing apps for both iOS and Android.
* Has a strong quality mindset and experience working with high UI/UX standards.
* Has experience with animations, caching, and performance optimization.
* Has experience with Bluetooth communication, preferably Bluetooth to an embedded product.
* Good to have experience with developing web-based applications.
* Thrives in a team environment and enjoys working with attention to detail.
* Meritorious to be familiar with software development according to regulatory frameworks for medical devices, for example, IEC 62304.



  





**Additional Information** 




 We apply an ongoing selection process so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible!
 



  





 If you have any questions don’t hesitate to reach out at jimmy@astaagency.se

title: Fullstack-utvecklare
description:
Är du en erfaren Fullstack-utvecklare som är redo för nya utmaningar? Vi letar efter dig som är redo att kliva ombord på vår tillväxtresa i ett nytt bolag inom mjukvara, Embedded-system och IT. Välkommen till ett företag där vi bygger framtidens lösningar.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Vi är inte som alla andra. Vi är Sigma Industry East North – en del av en prisbelönt koncern med hjärtat på rätt ställe och siktet inställt på både roligheter och kvalitet. Nu har vi startat ett helt nytt bolag med säte i Liljeholmen, där fokus är mjukvara och Embedded-system. Med oss får du möjligheten att vara med och bygga upp ett nytt företag från grunden, med allt vad det innebär av spännande utmaningar och möjligheter.
   

  

 GRUNDLÄGGANDE KVALIFIKATIONER
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har en bakgrund inom mjukvaruutveckling och har en stark vilja att utveckla både dig själv och andra, men framför allt leverera inom ditt gebit. Du är van vid att arbeta i agila projektmiljöer och har erfarenhet av att utveckla och implementera digitala lösningar i olika branscher. Du är kommunikativ, lösningsorienterad och trivs i en roll där du får kombinera djup teknisk kompetens med praktiskt ingenjörsarbete.
   

  

 MERITERANDE FÄRDIGHETER, EGENSKAPER OCH ERFARENHETER
   

  

**Kompetenskrav:** 
  

  

  

* Minst 5-8 års erfarenhet av Fullstack-programmering. :
+ Back-end i språk som Java, C# .Net, Python eller Node.js
+ Front-End i språk som Javascript, Typescript, CSS, och HTML

* Erfarenhet av olika ramverk som t ex React, Angular, Vue, SpringBoot etc.
* Erfarenhet av agila metoder (Scrum, Kanban, SAFe)
* Hänger bekvämt i databaser (SQL, Oracle, Mongo DB) och i molnet (AWS, Azure, GCP)
* Erfarenhet av Deployment och DevOps (exempelvis Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Terraform)
* Smidig i att balansera smart teknik med användarvänliga gränssnitt
* Behärskar svenska och engelska obehindrat både i tal och skrift.


**Meriterande:**
* Tidigare konsulterfarenhet och varit i flera branscher
* Andra programmeringsspråk som t ex PHP och Go
* Relevanta utbildningar och/eller certifieringar inom området
* Erfarenhet av mjukvarutestning och testautomatisering


 VI ERBJUDER
   

  

 Här får du vara med och bygga upp något från grunden i en arbetsmiljö med högt i tak, mycket skratt och ständig utveckling. Vi erbjuder även ett gäng fantastiska kollegor som är lika taggade som du, korta beslutsvägar, och spännande projekt som sträcker sig över flera olika branscher – från Fordon, Försvar och Tillverkning till Energi, Medtech, Telekom, Retail och IT.
   

  

 Vi värdesätter balans mellan arbete och fritid och erbjuder konkurrenskraftiga löner och förmåner, friskvårdsbidrag, samt möjligheter till personlig utveckling för att både kropp och knopp ska må bra.
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag
   

  

 2025-06-30
   

  

 MER INFORMATION
   

  

 För mer information kontakta:
   

  

 Ulrika Wergens
   

  

 Sektionschef
   

  

 Sigma Industry Spark, Stockholm
   

  

 Mjukvaruutveckling
   

  

 072-522 71 05
   

  

 ulrika.wergens@sigma.se
   

  

 LinkedIn
   

  

 072-522 71 05
   

  

 ulrika.wergens@sigma.se
   

  

 LinkedIn

title: Fullstack Developer - Research Department
description:
Do you wish to make a difference for cancer patients all around the world? RaySearch develops a suite of cancer care software, and we are now looking for a talented Fullstack Developer to our research department.
   

  

**About The Role**
 RaySearch Laboratories develops several software products focused on cancer care, primarily in radiation therapy. We are now looking for a skilled Fullstack Developer to join our research department and contribute to the development of key functionalities for our latest research projects.
   

  

 In this role, you will support our experts in physics, image analysis, and optimization by integrating their algorithms and work into our products. You will be one of two C# and WPF specialists serving as a bridge between the research and development departments. Your mission will be to ensure the quality of frontend and application-level work, and to uphold the architecture patterns and development processes used across the organization.
   

  

 Your main work will be in our treatment planning system, RayStation. The research department collaborates closely with RayStation development scrum teams, UX, DevOps, Machine Learning, and with cancer clinics and machine vendors around the globe.
   

  

**Your profile**
 You are motivated by increasing cancer patients’ chances of survival and recovery. You take responsibility, communicate clearly, and always strive to write clean, well-structured code that supports long-term development. You enjoy working in a technologically advanced environment alongside other highly skilled developers.
   

  

**Required Qualifications**
* M.Sc or Ph.D in a relevant field.
* 3+ years of experience with C# .Net.
* Experience working on large or advanced systems.
* Experience collaborating with other senior developers in a learning-focused environment.
* English.


**Meriting Qualifications**
* Experience in MedTech.
* Experience with WPF.
* Swedish language skills.


**Our Culture**
 Culture at RaySeach is the driving force behind our organization
 **, where** 
 everything we do is driven by a shared passion for innovation and the fight against cancer. Our dedication is reflected in our ability
 **to deliver** 
 exceptional results,
 **pay** 
 close attention to detail, and consistently
 **go** 
 the extra mile. Our employees stand out as experts in
 **their** 
 field
 **, driven by** 
 a relentless focus on solving problems
 **-** 
 no matter how complex. At RaySearch, we take pride in
 **leading the way in** 
 cancer treatment, leveraging cutting-edge technology to develop innovative
 **solutions** 
 that make a real difference in patient care.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 At RaySearch, we offer a diverse and inclusive work environment, fostering openness, sincerity, and collaboration. Located in Hagastaden, Stockholm's Life Science Hub, our modern and creative workspace includes an in-house gym, yoga, and social activities like ping pong, table football, and regular after-work events. Our bistro serves a fantastic lunch buffet, and we offer morning- and afternoon-fika every day. Our rooftop terrace also provides a stunning 360-degree view of Stockholm, enhancing the work experience. All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package.
   

  

**Application**
 Please apply to the position through the application form below. We do not accept applications by e-mail. Selection and interviews will be ongoing.

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
**Expleo** 
 is seeking a highly skilled and experienced
 **Fullstack Developer** 
 to join our team in
 **Sweden** 
 (located in Gothenburg OR Stockholm).
   

  

 Our
 **ideal** 
 candidate has an always-on mindset with a strong background in designing, configuring, and managing solutions for devices, tools, and applications in a factory/corporate setting.

title: Senior Frontend Developer
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Vill du dra nytta av din kunskap och erfarenhet inom modern frontendutveckling? Vill du axla en nyckelroll på ett världsledande bolag som utvecklar spännande mjukvarulösningar till kunder över hela världen? Vi på Systecon drivs av utveckling och brinner för att bidra till samhällsnyttan. För att lyckas krävs avancerade metoder, kraftfulla verktyg – och framför allt: rätt personer. Vill du följa med på resan?* 




  





**Vad ska vi åstadkomma tillsammans?** 




 Vi på Systecon söker nu en erfaren och kunnig utvecklare inom frontend som vill vara med och forma framtidens digitala verktyg för Life Cycle Management (LCM). Hos oss blir du en del av ett litet men växande team där din individuella insats spelar en avgörande roll. Just nu satsar vi stort på vår R&D-avdelning och moderniserar vår tekniska plattform, och därför söker vi dig som kan stärka vår frontendutveckling och bidra med din expertis. Vi har en dynamisk och internationell arbetsmiljö där kunskapsdelning, mentorskap och personlig utveckling står i fokus. Här blir du inte bara en del av teamet – du blir en nyckelspelare som bidrar till vår kultur, stärker dina kollegor och utvecklar både företaget och dig själv!
 



  





**Som utvecklare hos Systecon kommer du att:** 



* Utveckla desktopapplikationer i en modern web-stack.
* Du ska trivas med att ta stora datamängder och göra informationen lättillgänglig för användare.
* Arbeta nära teamet med par- och mobprogrammering.
* Samla in användarfeedback och designa användargränssnitt baserat på behov.
* Bygga gränssnitt för prestandakritiska algoritmer i samarbete med andra utvecklarteam.
* Bidra till att modernisera Systecons verktyg, produkter och interna tech-stack.
* Skriva kod, tester och dokumentation; samt säkerställa funktionalitet i CI/CD-loopar.



  










**Vi tror att du har:** 



* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av frontendutveckling med starka kunskaper i
 **TypeScript** 
 .
* Mycket god erfarenhet av ramverket
 **React.**
* Ett intresse för design och UX/UI, samt förmåga att skapa användarvänliga och visuellt tilltalande gränssnitt.
* God kommunikationsförmåga på både svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift.
* Du trivs med att samarbeta i team och vill gärna dela med dig av din kompetens.
* Eftergymnasial utbildning som inkluderar datavetenskap.



  





**Det är ett plus om du dessutom har:** 



* Erfarenhet av datadrivet beslutsstöd eller BI-verktyg.
* Kunskaper i Python eller C++ som är de dominerande språken i backend.
* God förståelse för mjukvaruarkitektur.



  





**Vad erbjuder vi dig** 
 ?
 


* **Personlig utveckling:** 
 Tid och stöd för att växa, både professionellt och personligt, samt tillgång till en utbildningspott som kan användas för kurser och utbildningsmaterial, t.ex. böcker, programvara, samt online-tjänster.
* **Frihet och ansvar** 
 : Stor personlig frihet att ta initiativ och styra din egen tid.
* **Internationell tillväxtresa:** 
 Möjlighet att bidra till vår spännande expansion globalt.
* **Lärorik arbetsmiljö:** 
 Varierande arbetsdagar med kunniga, stöttande kollegor och moderna teknologier.
* **Friskvård och välmående:** 
 Friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 SEK för aktiviteter och återhämtning, samt kontinuerliga gemensamma friskvårdsaktiviteter arrangerad under året.
* **Flexibelt arbetssätt:** 
 Hybridlösning som kombinerar arbete på vårt centrala Stockholmskontor och distansarbete.
* **Teamaktiviteter och gemenskap:** 
 Årlig konferensresa – tidigare resmål inkluderar Lissabon och Åre.



  





**Om oss:** 




 Vi på
 **Systecon** 
 brinner för att hjälpa våra kunder världen över att fatta långsiktigt hållbara beslut. Genom vår egenutvecklade och världsledande programvarusvit Opus Suite skapar vi effektivare drift och underhåll för ledande organisationer inom branscher som försvar, järnväg och energi. Vår styrka ligger i korta beslutsvägar och den fantastiska gemenskap som genomsyrar vårt företag. Vi hjälper varandra och kan stoltsera med en gedigen kunskapsbas och omfattande erfarenhet.
 



 Vi som jobbar här har olika bakgrund, ålder och utbildning men vi har också något gemensamt: vi drivs av utveckling och brinner för att vara med och bidra till samhällsnyttan. Vårt uppdrag är att hjälpa företag att effektivt köpa, drifta och avveckla komplexa och kostsamma system, och med vår egenutvecklade och världsledande programvarusvit, Opus Suite, kan kunder över hela världen modellera, simulera och optimera både tillgänglighet och kostnader – något som gör verklig skillnad i deras verksamhet.
 



  





 Välkommen att göra skillnad hos oss på Systecon - urval sker löpande så skicka in din ansökan redan idag. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
 



  





 För kontakt eller frågor: anna.bohman@systecongroup.com

title: Senior Software Engineer (Fullstack: .NET/React/AWS)
description:
**What We Do At Qliro**
 At Qliro we deliver safe and simple payments. We are a dedicated partner to our merchants who serve their customers every day. We believe that if our merchants grow, we grow. We are a company of dedicated, friendly and highly competent people that together have redefined what Qliro and payments can be. We are now on a journey of scaling our business both here in Sweden and the Nordics.
   

  

**What Your Team Does**
 Earlier Qliro focused on a few big customers, today we have pivoted and now we are going for the entire e-com market, starting in the Nordics but aiming to be a European leader. To succeed we must automate the system configurations. We also need to build the new best-in-class tooling where merchants can onboard themselves.
   

  

 Your new team owns the automation and self-configuration tools. This is a greenfield project based upon AWS step-functions, .NET and React. We fully own our domain, where to go and how to get there.
   

  

 We believe that you work best autonomously and thrive in collaboration with others. You think greenfield is exciting where you have an impact on the vision and take a broader role in developing our products. Working together with other teams, PMs and stakeholders comes naturally. You are comfortable in both frontend and backend and can elevate the view to lead architectural discoveries when needed.
   

  

**What You Will Bring To The Team**
* 5+ years as a fullstack engineer
* Fearless to dive into architectural discussions and explore on your own
* Modern Javascript framework and .NET or JAVA in backend


**Tech stack**
* React
* .NET
* AWS (various tools)
* Cypress
* Microservices


 We're excited to hear from you!
   

  

*Qliro is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to gender, gender identity or expression, national origin, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual* 
 orientation
 *or age.*

title: Senior Backend Software Engineer – Data Solutions
description:
**What We Are Looking For**
 We are looking for a
 **Senior Backend Software Engineer** 
 to join our
 **Data Solutions** 
 team at Brite! If you have a passion for building greenfield data products, working with modern technologies like Google Cloud Platform (GCP), and want to play a key role in shaping our solutions, this is the perfect opportunity for you.
   

  

 As a senior backend engineer on the Data Solutions team, you’ll work in a lean, fast, and collaborative environment. Our approach is iterative, and we focus on continuously improving not only our products but also our technology and ways of working. You will join a greenfield team, building from the ground up with minimal legacy code, focusing on modern serverless technologies.
   

  

* 5 years of experience as a Software Engineer, with a strong background in backend development.
* Proficiency in Python and familiarity with modern workflows like lean, agile, and DevOps.
* A curious and open-minded approach to teamwork and problem-solving.
* A proactive mindset with a willingness to take more responsibility and drive decisions.
* Experience with cloud technologies, especially Google Cloud Platform (GCP), or other cloud providers.


**Meritorious**
* Experience building data-driven solutions.
* Familiarity with serverless architectures or cloud-native applications.


 If you’re looking for an environment where your work makes a real impact, where you’ll have the freedom to innovate, and where collaboration and mutual respect are at the core of everything we do, we want to hear from you!
   

  

**Join us** 
 and be part of a team that’s building the next generation of data solutions. 🌍💻🚀
   

  

**About Brite**
 Founded in 2019, Brite Payments is a leading open banking-powered account-to-account (A2A) payment provider of instant payments, payouts, and other financial services in Europe. Brite is committed to creating fast, secure, and transparent payment solutions that reduce risk for businesses and provide consumers with the best possible payment experience.
   

  

 At the heart of Brite is our proprietary instant payments network, Brite IPN, which enables real-time, 24/7 transaction processing with no delays, sign-ups, or card details required. Today, Brite connects with over 3,800 banks in 27 European markets and is committed to delivering cutting-edge, next-generation payment solutions that meet the market’s evolving needs.
   

  

 Headquartered in Stockholm, Brite has offices in London and Malaga and now numbers over 170+ colleagues.
   

  

 Want to join us on our journey? The future is Brite!
