title: Software Test Engineer
description:
As a global technology leader with over 150 years of innovation, we are driving the development of premium solutions that optimize performance, safety and sustainability in the manufacturing industry. Atlas Copco Industrial Technique’s systems empower global industry users to control assembly processes.  

We are looking for a Software Test Engineer. Join our team and enjoy a supportive work environment with opportunities for professional growth and flexible working hours.  

**Your role**  

As a test developer in our team, you design, implement and run test scripts that regression test software intended for products that support an automated assembly industry. You work with complex and large embedded industrial systems in cross-functional and agile teams, and are involved in all steps of the process - from first idea to product. The solutions we develop are used to improve efficiency, quality, safety, speed, ergonomics and environmental performance.  

**Location:** Stockholm, Nacka  

**You will need**

* You hold a masters degree in science within mechatronics/computer science or equivalent and have experience in automatic software test design, programming in Python and from complex or large embedded systems. Preferably you hold an ISTQB certification.
* You can work with test within all abstraction levels in embedded software from low level driver control to application level.
* You are fluent in English.

**We offer you**


At Atlas Copco, we value your work and who you are. We believe that the one closest to the problem is the one closest to the solution. We have a collaborative and supportive work environment embracing different perspectives. Our internal job market unlocks opportunities for you to explore and to develop new skills.


You are welcome to contact the recruiting manager Razu Khan, razu.khan@atlascopco.com, if you have any questions about the role. We are looking forward to your application via our job site!


**Diverse by nature and inclusive by choice**  

Bright ideas come from all of us. The more unique perspectives we embrace, the more innovative we are. Together we build a culture where difference is valued and we share a deep sense of purpose and belonging.
company_description: Atlas Copco transforms industrial ideas into business value since 1873. Headquartered in Sweden, we serve 180+ countries. Learn more: www.atlascopcogroup.com

title: Software Test Engineer
description:
If you are a professional looking for an opportunity to grow and develop your abilities within a dynamic business, Emerson has an appealing role for you!
  
As a Software Test Engineer, you will be responsible for the planning and reporting results of product verification related to software execution of a web-based System Software platform, as well as maintaining applicable lab-rooms and equipment, test infrastructure and target systems.
  
If this sounds like an interesting job for you, we welcome your application!
  
  

**In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:**  

Create and maintain manual and automated test cases to verify product requirements
  
Create, review, maintain and execute automated test scripts
  
Contribute to test plan by identifying test scope, timelines, risk and mitigation plans for every product increment window
  
Coordinate test activities such as penetration tests and interoperability tests performed at external test partners
  
Collaborate with other product and scrum teams to connect various components and perform system level tests on the platform
  
  

**Who You Are:**  

You create teamwork allowing others across the organization to achieve shared objectives. You persist in accomplishing objectives despite obstacles and setbacks. You uncover root causes to difficult problems. You scan the environment for new technical skills, knowledge, or capabilities that can benefit business or personal performance.
  
  

**For This Role, You Will Need:**  

Technical education at Master or Bachelor level
  
At least 5 years of relevant experience as a Software Test Engineer in an Agile team
  
English and Swedish languages proficiency
  
Good knowledge in Test automation using Selenium with C#/Java
  
  

**Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:**  

Understanding of communication protocols such as OPC UA, HART, Modbus
  
Experience working in a matrix organization
  
  

Our Culture & Commitment to You
  
At Emerson, we prioritize a workplace where every employee is valued, respected, and empowered to grow. We foster an environment that encourages innovation, collaboration, and diverse perspectives—because we know that great ideas come from great teams. Our commitment to ongoing career development and growing an inclusive culture ensures you have the support to thrive. Whether through mentorship, training, or leadership opportunities, we invest in your success so you can make a lasting impact. We believe diverse teams, working together are key to driving growth and delivering business results.
  
**For additional information, please reach out to:** bala.pattabiraman@emerson.com
  
No calls or agencies please.

title: Service Engineer
description:
Service Engineer*Want to influence the bigger picture? At Saab, you can realise amazing innovations that keep people and societies safe. Together, we can truly make an impact – and your part matters.*
We are looking for service engineers for our sites in Stockholm and Karlskrona.
The Surveillance business area, which includes Combat Systems, offers world-leading sensor technology in surveillance and decision support to protect against threats. The portfolio includes airborne, ground-based and marine radars, electronic warfare, combat management, aviation systems and cyber security. Operations are conducted in Sweden, USA, UK, Australia, Germany, South Africa, United Arab Emirates, Norway, Denmark and Finland.
We provide commissioning and field service on Saab 9LV combat systems. We work in all phases of a project, from commissioning, setting to work, training, acceptance to support after system delivery. You will collaborate with experienced engineers and professionals in an environment that fosters career development and personal growth. With us, you will work with exciting technology in advanced and complex systems.
Our products are used on marine platforms (platforms above and below the water surface) and have the task of compiling information from sensors, data links and weapon systems in order to give the operator the best opportunity to make the right decision.
We are based in Järfälla, Stockholm and Karlskrona, Blekinge.
Your role
You will take part in projects from initial commissioning to final delivery of a ship as well as surveys on upcoming midlife upgrades and support activities for delivered systems. The role is multi-disciplinary and dynamic and your task will vary during the progress of the project. As a Service Engineer, you will work in close cooperation with System Engineers and Software Integrators from Saab as well as working with technical representatives of the various subsupplier organizations and shipyards. Service Engineers are the ones responsible for getting the system installed and the ship up and running. We can promise that your days will be varied and filled with opportunities to demonstrate your problem solving abilities.
Your Profile
You are a confident communicator in Swedish and English. You share information in a clear and easy way, verbally and in writing. You have a collaborative mind-set and you are a true team player. You are self-driven with a “get the job done” attitude. Curiosity and the ability to learn new technical areas are necessary attributes for the role.
We believe that you have a solid technical background with a wide technical knowledge base and interest.
Required skills:* Formal degree from technical high school, or equivalent
* Experience in working with commissioning and installation of both hardware and software
* Troubleshooting and reparations skills
* Service and maintenance knowledge


Desired skills:* Experience in the naval domain and or defense industry
* Network and network switches knowledge
* Linux command line
* Functional diagram understanding
* Serial communication (ex RS 422)


The position will require travels within Sweden and internationally, depending on the program phase and requirements.
This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.
What you will be part of
Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.
Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.
Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 25,500 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here*Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement.*
Contact information: Angelica Kjellsson, Manager E-mail: angelica.kjellsson@saabgroup.com
Contact information: Nina Torebrink, Recruiter E-mail: nina.torebrink@saabgroup.com

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
RaySearch is at the forefront of cancer treatment technology, and we are now looking for a skilled frontend engineer to join our team. This is a unique opportunity to shape the frontend experience of RayIntelligence, our analytics tool for radiotherapy that aggregates data from various systems and machines, empowering clinics to draw valuable insights from a population of treated patients.
   

  

**About The Position**
 As the first frontend engineer in our team, you will play a key role in designing and implementing modern user interfaces that visualize large and complex datasets. RayIntelligence is still in its early stages, giving you the chance to influence both design decisions and the overall frontend architecture.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Develop modern web applications with Apache Superset at the core.
* Build dynamic, high-quality Apache ECharts visualizations, using React/TypeScript (JavaScript)/CSS.
* Collaborate closely with data engineers and domain experts in radiotherapy to ensure an optimal user experience.
* Learn about the radiotherapy domain to tailor solutions for clinics’ needs.


**Your Profile**
 We are looking for a frontend engineer with a strong sense of ownership and an interest for creating intuitive and visually compelling user interfaces. You should be comfortable working in a data-heavy environment and be eager to expand your technical expertise.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Experience developing modern web applications.
* Ability to take ownership of long and short term assignments, and deliver high-quality solutions.
* UI and graphic design sensibilities.
* Technical expertise in frontend engineering, including optimizing performance and architecting scalable solutions
* Solid understanding of general software engineering best practices, including:


 - Version control & code reviews - Unit & end-to-end testing, automated testing in CI/CD - Writing clean, reusable, and scalable code - Documentation
   

  

**Meriting**
* Experience with advanced data visualization tools such as D3.js, THREE.js, or WebGL.
* Python


**Our Culture**
 At RaySearch, we share a passion for innovation and the fight against cancer. Our team consists of dedicated experts who strive to deliver exceptional results through collaboration, attention to detail, and cutting-edge technology. We take pride in our role as a leader in cancer treatment, developing solutions that truly make a difference for patients worldwide.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 We offer a dynamic and inclusive work environment in Hagastaden, Stockholm’s Life Science Hub. Our modern office space includes an in-house gym, yoga classes, and social activities such as ping pong, table football, and after-work events. We also provide a fantastic lunch buffet, daily fika, and a stunning rooftop terrace with a 360-degree view of Stockholm. This comes with a competitive compensation and benefits package.
   

  

**Application**
 Please apply for the position through the application form below. We do not accept applications via e-mail.

title: AI Engineer, Sweden - BCG X
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.
   

  

 To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.
   

  

**We Are BCG X**
 We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.
   

  

 Our AI Software Engineers and Senior AI Software Engineers are part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.
   

  

 We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Software Development, Large-scale Data Analytics And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following
   

  

* Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
* Actively involved in every part of the software development process
* Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
* Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
* Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
* Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
* A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics


 What You'll Bring
   

  

**Technologies**
 Programming Languages: Python
   

  

 #BCGXjob
   

  

 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Application Engineer
description:
Scanditron is a market-leading supplier of machines and services for electronic production in Scandinavia and the Baltics. Founded in 1969, Scanditron has been part of the Swedish Kamic Group since 2001. We have sales and service operations in Sweden, Finland, Denmark, Norway, and Poland, and are also present in Estonia, Lithuania, and Latvia.
 



  





  





 Position: Application Engineer (Based in Sweden)
 



 We are currently in an expansive phase and are looking for a Application Engineer with focus on FUJI pick and place system.
 



  





 Responsibilities:
 


* Improve productivity at our customers by guiding how to use smart SW
* Conduct service, repair, and installation of products at customer sites and provide remote support.
* Sales support
* Phone and remote support.
* The role requires a willingness to travel, as most work is performed at customer locations.



  





 Training:
 


* Training will be provided by our suppliers and through on-the-job training with one of your colleagues.



  





 What We Offer:
 


* An exciting role in a growing business.
* The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and high-end products from globally recognized brands.
* Interesting international work with strong support from colleagues and suppliers.
* An attractive compensation package and flexible working hours.
* Continuous training on products and processes.
* Work location can be our office in Spånga, Stockholm, or home-based.



  





 Qualifications:
 


* Technical education
* Strong communication skills.
* Knowledge of electronic production and preferably knowledge about pick and place machines like FUJI, ASMPT, MYCRONIC.
* Good computer skills with analytical troubleshooting and problem-solving abilities.
* Proficiency in written and spoken English.
* Possession of a driving license and willingness to travel (70% - 80%).
* Highly organized and capable of managing administrative tasks, including service reports and customer queries
* Basic DB skills.

title: Embedded C/C++ Developers
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
Are you a talented
 **C/C++ developer** 
 seeking your next opportunity? Join the Embedded Systems department in Stockholm, where exciting challenges await!
 



  





 The ALTEN Stockholm office is home to a dynamic, highly skilled team of engineers and developers from all over the world who specialize in delivering tailored solutions across sectors like automotive, telecommunications, life sciences, and IT. Known for their collaborative spirit, the team combines deep technical expertise with a proactive, problem-solving approach, fostering an environment where creativity and efficiency meet to drive impactful results for clients. With a strong focus on professional development and a supportive culture, the Stockholm team is dedicated to both individual growth and collective success, making it an exciting and empowering place to be a part of.
 



  





  





**WHAT WE OFFER YOU** 




 Every employee is equally valuable in the success of ALTEN! We believe in growing together by offering opportunities, development and togetherness.
 



 ALTEN operates in several different industries, having a wide variety of assignments, coaching managers and training through ALTEN Academy, which means that it will always be possible to develop at ALTEN. Your wishes will guide your way forward.
 



 As a consultant, you will get the genuine team feeling at your assignment but also a wonderful togetherness at ALTEN. Through our different internal networks, such as Women@ALTEN and ALTEN Sports you will get the opportunity to drive topics and activities that are close to your heart. At ALTEN, we think it's important to have a balance between work and spare time, which is why we offer three extra days off a year. We have a collective agreement and offer benefits like pension, insurances and wellness grants.
 



  





  





**WHAT WILL YOU DO** 




**Design and Develop** 
 : Create high-quality, real-time embedded software solutions in C++ for various industries.
 



**Innovate** 
 : Work on the latest technologies such as IoT, AI, and autonomous systems, contributing to exciting projects that shape the future.
 



**Collaborate** 
 : Join forces with talented engineers across multiple disciplines to deliver state-of-the-art products and systems.
 



**Problem Solve** 
 : Tackle technical challenges with creativity and out-of-the-box thinking, ensuring optimal performance and reliability.
 



**Grow** 
 : Expand your knowledge through ongoing training, support, and career development within a dynamic, international environment.
 



  





  





**WHO ARE YOU** 



* 3+ years in Embedded C/C++ software development within the automotive industry.
* Strong proficiency in real-time systems, and embedded platforms (ARM, FPGA, etc.).
* Python.
* Bash.
* Jenkins.
* Classic or Adaptive AUTOSAR.
* Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field.
* Meritorius: experience of Yocto and Buildroot as well as with microcontrollers



  





  





**ABOUT ALTEN** 




 ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest technology and IT consulting companies with over 57,000 employees in nearly 30 countries. Our engineers carry out complex and highly technical projects throughout the value chain of the most prestigious companies in all sectors, such as Automotive, Defense, Energy & Environment, Industry, Public services & Government and Life Sciences. In Sweden, we are about 1300 committed employees with 9 offices in 9 cities - from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north. For the fifth year in a row, ALTEN has been named one of Sweden's most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen, an award for employers that offer unique career and development opportunities.

title: Game Tools Engineer
description:
As a Game Tools Programmer at Embark you will focus on helping our developers and content creators on Arc Raiders to continuously find ways to make us more efficient in our day to day game development.
   

  

 We believe that great games are made in creative environments, where builds are always playable, and teams can move fast and test as many ideas as possible. In close collaboration with our designers and programmers, you will create easy-to-use tools that enable us to iterate quickly and that encourage experimentation.
   

  

 The games and tooling we're making are built in mostly Unreal, using C++, blueprints and a scripting language called Angelscript.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* By own initiative find opportunities to improve or build tooling to further improve our workflows and ways of making games
* Occasionally assist our team in debugging and fixing complex issues within unreal editor
* Occasionally build content validators to prevent errors reaching the build by checking content validation already in editor


**We would love if you have**
* A creative and curious mind
* A strong background in C++
* Experience with Unreal Engine
* Fluent in English - our team comes from all over the world!
* An interest in computer science and programming as a craft


**Additionally one or some of these would be a great bonus**
* Previously worked with shooter or third-person games
* Ability to speak "design"


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Embedded Software Developer (R&D)
description:
Long Description
   

  

 Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
   

  

**Your Role**
 As an Embedded Software Developer, you will focus on developing embedded software, mainly but not exclusively within the Automotive Industry.
   

  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*
* Developing software using C and C++ programming languages.
* Using MATLAB and Simulink for modeling and potentially generating C code.
* Writing unit tests or other test cases (Python).
* Working with real-time operating systems (RTOS) and embedded Linux or other embedded operating systems.


**Your Profile**
 We are now looking for an individual who is highly motivated and has a strong background in embedded systems engineering.
   

  

 To be successful in this role, we are happy to see that you have:
   

  

* At least 5 years of experience with embedded programming in C/C++.
* Experience with MATLAB and Simulink.
* Experience with hardware-related programming and debugging, including JTAG and other debugging tools.
* Knowledge of real-time operating systems (RTOS) and experience with embedded Linux or other embedded operating systems.


**Job Description**
 What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here
   

  

* Innovative Projects: Dive into exciting projects at the forefront of automotive development, shaping the future of mobility.
* Top-Notch Tools: Access the latest tools and technologies, empowering you to excel in your craft.
* Collaborative Environment: Work alongside a talented team of professionals, collaborating seamlessly to conquer challenges and achieve excellence.
* Continuous Growth: Fuel your passion for learning with ongoing training and development opportunities, staying ahead of the curve in the ever-evolving automotive landscape.


**Application and Contact**
 Selection and interviews are running continuously. Apply now since we assign roles during the whole application time span. For questions and for more information, contact Jan Hansson, Talent Acquisition Partner, at 0725-616900.
   

  

 Kindly note that due to GDPR, we will not accept applications via mail. Please use our career site.
   

  

 We kindly but firmly refrain from direct contact with staffing, brokerage, and recruitment companies as well as other external actors and sellers of additional job advertisements.
   

  

*As part of our recruitment process, identity verification and background checks may occasionally be conducted.*
**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market-leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud, and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Radio SW 5G Developer
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 Are you at the start or about to start your career?
   

  

 We are now expanding our team and looking for new colleagues with a passion and interest in C++ and 5G Radio SW development!
   

  

 We are seeking enthusiastic new C++ developers to join our dynamic software development teams. Upon joining you will become part of a multi-functional team responsible for tasks ranging from initial studies to customer acceptance testing of new radio functionality.
   

  

 Your role will involve designing, developing, and optimizing software solutions, particularly focusing on radio software applications using C++ and Java-based test frameworks within agile development practices.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, develop, and test software solutions.
* Participate in system design, software development, and comprehensive testing of Radio Units.
* Tackle complex technological challenges alongside experienced colleagues.
* Contribute to end-to-end embedded development activities, closely coordinating with both software and hardware teams.
* Engage in software application development primarily using C++, alongside Java-based test framework development.


**The skills you bring:**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Wireless Communication, or a related technical field.
* 2-3 years experience with object-oriented C++ programming.
* Good understanding of Linux-based development environments.
* Familiarity with essential software development tools including version control systems, build systems, and scripting languages.
* Basic knowledge of CI/CD processes.
* Awareness of agile software development methodologies, such as Scrum or Kanban.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

title: Backend Engineer
description:
**Brinner du för att utveckla backend-system i Python och vill jobba i ett mindre team med stor möjlighet att vara med och påverka?** 
 Vi söker en Backend Engineer som vill ta ansvar för att planera och driva projekt som maximerar Wallism värdeskapande. Tillsammans med ett team om sex engagerade kollegor i en öppen och tillitsfull miljö, där du rapporterar till och samarbetar tätt med Oscar, vår Systemarkitekt, får du vara med och bygga nästa generations e-handel för tapeter. Tillsammans skapar vi automatiserade och framåtlutade lösningar för bolagets globala försäljning.
 



 Om du har gedigen
 **erfarenhet av Python** 
 och trivs med att
 **både utveckla och optimera driftsmiljöer för att leverera värde till kunderna** 
 , ser vi fram emot din ansökan!
 



  





**Du kommer att:** 



* Vara med och utveckla och optimera infrastrukturen för vår webbplats och vårt microtjänstkluster.
* Bidra till design och implementering av en stabil och skalbar driftmiljö.
* Säkerställa en robust drift genom kontinuerlig utveckling och förbättring av vår infrastruktur.
* Analysera och optimera flöden för tillväxt
* Felsöka och avhjälpa problem på ett effektivt sätt.



  





**Vi tror att du har:** 




* Minst fem års god erfarenhet som inom backend
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Python, inklusive erfarenhet av vanliga ramverk och bibliotek.
* God förmåga att dokumentera tekniska lösningar, API:er och processer.



  





**Vi ser gärna även att du har erfarenhet av något eller flera av dessa områden:** 



* Akademisk utbildning inom relevant IT-område.
* Erfarenhet av eventdriven arkitektur och olika typer av databaser (relationella, dokument, sök).
* God förståelse för DevOps-principer och CI/CD-pipelines.
* Erfarenhet av agilt arbete i team.
* Erfarenhet av containerisering (t.ex. Docker, Kubernetes) och Linux.
* Erfarenhet av TypeScript och/eller webbutveckling.



  





**Om bolaget:** 




 Vi på Wallism är ett teknikdrivet e-handelsbolag som omdefinierar marknaden för tapeter och muraler globalt. Genom vår strategiska satsning på mjukvaruutveckling skapar vi innovativa digitala lösningar och en sömlös kundupplevelse. Vår styrka ligger i vårt engagerade team, där varje medlem bidrar med sina unika färdigheter för att påverka produktens utveckling och vår fortsatta expansion. Vi verkar nu på över 20 marknader världen över, och trots vår snabba tillväxt behåller vi vårt fokus på personlig kundservice, vilket bevisas av vår höga kundnöjdhet och starka betyg på Trustpilot. Hos oss delar vi en gemensam passion för att utmana gränser och skapa en digital framtid där kreativitet och innovation möts.
 



  





 📍
 **Låter det intressant?** 
 Ansök idag och bli en del av vårt team!

title: System engineer
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with cancer.**
**What You’ll Do At Elekta**
 As a Systems Engineer your primary responsibility will be to ensure adequate quality in design input for the development of our future radiation therapy products. You will be part of a system engineering team in an agile program working according to SAFe, where you will be contributing in all systems engineering activities. The system engineering team coordinates the development in subsystem teams, that are located at several sites around the world.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Supporting and mentoring development teams formalizing subsystem design input
* Driving or participating in all systems engineering activities like system design, requirements engineering, risk management, and usability engineering
* Working together with the subsystem teams to find and document solutions in a structured way
* Driving relentless improvements of procedures and ways of working


**The right stuff**
 To be a suitable candidate for this position we think you have
   

  

* A master’s degree in engineering physics, electrical engineering, computer science, mechanical engineering, or equivalent
* Experience in the application of system engineering practices
* Experience in requirements engineering and/or risk management
* Demonstrated aptitude for systems thinking
* Broad and genuine interest in technology
* The ability to holistically understand the user’s need, the technology in the system, and how the different parts in the system will need to interact to perform system functions
* Experience of building and maintaining successful and effective working relationships with engineering peers and stakeholders
* Experience of working in a regulated industry, preferably in the medical sector
* A personality based on strong ethical standards, values and good judgement
* Excellent command of English, both written and spoken


**What You Bring**
 Besides living by our values, your ability to getting things done with a can-do attitude and your aptitude for applying systems thinking will be success factors for you in this position. To fit well with your responsibilities and with the team, you are a true team player keen on establishing an atmosphere where people help each other to succeed and to have fun at work.
   

  

*We encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every requirement—your unique skills and experiences might be exactly what we’re looking for!*
**What You’ll Get**
 In this role, you will work for a higher purpose:
 **hope for everyone dealing with cancer** 
 , and for everyone—regardless of where they are in the world—to have access to the best cancer care. At Elekta, you'll be part of an innovative and purpose-driven team, working with world-class technology to improve lives. We offer flexible working conditions, international collaboration, and opportunities for career development and learning.
   

  

**Hiring process**
 We look forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and résumé in English via the “Apply” button.
   

  

**Your Elekta contact**
 For questions regarding this role, please contact our Global Talent Acquisition Partner responsible Gustaf Ericson at gustaf.ericson@elekta.com. We do not accept applications via e-mail.
   

  

**About Elekta**
 As a leader in precision radiation therapy, Elekta is committed to ensuring every patient has access to the best cancer care possible. Elekta is a proud innovator and supplier of equipment and software used to improve, prolong, and save the lives of people with cancer and brain disorders.
   

  

 More than 6,000 hospitals worldwide rely on Elekta technology. We openly collaborate with customers to advance sustainable, outcome-driven, and cost-efficient solutions to meet evolving patient needs, improve lives, and bring hope to everyone dealing with cancer. To us, it’s personal, and our global team of 4,700 employees combines passion, science, and imagination to profoundly change cancer care.
 **We don’t just build technology, we build hope.**
 Elekta is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with a presence in more than 120 countries and listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For more information, visit elekta.com or follow @Elekta on Twitter and on LinkedIn.

title: Co-Founding CTO
job_function: Information Technology, Business Development, and Management
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
Ready to build your startup and get funded in 10 weeks? We’re a global early-stage VC backing founders from day zero. We invest up to €400k through our founder residency – a building sprint where you leverage community, sparring, and intense effort to make 1 year of progress in 10 weeks.
 



  





**About Antler** 




  





 Join the next Nordics residency starting
 **September 1st, 2025, in Stockholm** 
 . Build your company alongside a cohort of pre-vetted, exceptional potential co-founders, validate your ideas, engage with customers, develop your MVP, refine your business model, and create your go-to-market strategy before pitching to the investment committee.
 



  





**Who Makes a Great Technical Founder?** 




  





 As a technical founder, your expertise in software engineering, AI/ML, data science, or deep tech will be critical in building and scaling a venture-backed startup. You might be:
 



  




* A CTO or senior engineering leader ready to transition from building for others to founding your own company.
* A deep tech or AI/ML expert with a vision for how emerging technologies can solve critical problems.
* A full-stack or backend engineer eager to take ownership of a product from zero to one.
* A technical architect or hands-on builder who thrives on solving complex technical challenges at scale.



  





**Founder DNA: What Sets You Apart?** 




  





 Beyond technical ability, the best startup CTOs have:
 



  




* Inner drive – You have a vision for what you want to build and the ambition to execute.
* Creative problem-solving – You don’t just code; you build scalable systems and innovative solutions.
* Grit – You thrive in uncertainty, iterate quickly, and push through technical and business challenges.



  





**The Antler Founder Residency:** 




 The residency starts on
 **September 1st, 2025,** 
 and runs for
 **10 weeks** 
 ,
 **full-time** 
 ,
 **in-person in Stockholm** 
 . Any adjustments have to be agreed to in the interview process.
 



 Our residency program is fairly unstructured, with 90%+ of the time focused dedicated to founders working on their companies and making week-over-week progress. Here are some examples of things that founders focus on, depending on where they are at in their company journey:
 



  




* Find and vet potential cofounders
* Validate core assumptions around your business ideas and find meaningful market insight
* Build prototypes, find design partners, launch pilots, close customers
* Get feedback from functional experts and dedicated coaches
* Reach milestones that align with pre-seed funding



  





 If founders have already accomplished any of the above, they dedicate their full effort on the next most important milestones.
 



  





**Antler Investment Process** 



* At the end of the 10-week residency, you will have the opportunity to present to the Antler Investment Committee. If approved by the investment committee, you will receive a pre-seed commitment of
 **€400,000** 
 in two tranches. €100k for 10% and €300k in follow-on capital.
* Companies that receive investment at the end of the residency will join the Antler portfolio and gain even higher touch programming from our partners. This includes access our network of downstream investors, integration into the Antler Nordics portfolio and global portfolio network, and introductions to relevant partners and discounted service providers.



  





**About Antler** 




 Antler is a early-stage VC that is changing the way people build companies. We operate in 30 locations worldwide, have supported 8,000+ founders through our residencies, and invested in 1500+ startups globally. We launched Antler to build a better on-ramp to venture capital. After working in venture-backed companies for years, we built Antler to provide founders with a structured and transparent process to successfully launch a new venture, a community for support throughout the experience, and a clear pathway to venture funding.
 



  





**Antler Highlights:** 




 Some examples of successful companies that were built as a result of Antler’s residency, received pre-seed investment from Antler, and have gone on to raise substantial investments are as follows:
 


* **Airalo:** 
 The world’s first eSIM subscription and top-up store
* **Wingbits** 
 : Incentive-based flight tracking platform
* **Treyd:** 
 Working capital operating system for B2B
* **Reebelo:** 
 Used electronics marketplace
* **Telgea:** 
 Global telecom operator
* **Glint Solar:** 
 Software for identifying the best solar sites faster



  





**Cohort starts: September 1st, 2025, but we're working with founders all year round on an ad hoc basis.** 




  





**APPLY NOW**

title: Systems Engineer-Scandinavia
description:
**Join Extreme Networks, a leading provider of cloud-managed networking solutions.**
 We're seeking a talented Systems Engineer to join our dynamic team to work in Scandinavia and to contribute our mission of simplifying and securing the access network.
   

 There has never been a better time to join Extreme Networks, with several acquisitions extending our portfolio and go to market strategy, we have seen enormous opportunity and growth within the region.
   

 Aside from being a Technology Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant, we also adamantly promote an internal culture that truly embraces diversity, inclusion and equality in the workplace.
   

 Extreme Systems Engineer provides technology and product consulting, technical sales support for various account opportunities, performs high-level and in-depth technical presentations for customers, prospects, and Extreme channel partners in the territory of responsibility.
   

 Extreme Systems Engineer also provides support for RFI/RFP responses, organizes and leads Proof of Concept activities, designs solutions meeting customer requirements.
   

 Systems Engineer is also required to participate with assigned virtual teams and contribute to other team activities.
   

 Domestic/International travel will be required.
   

**Candidate Requirements**
* Excellent presentation skills (fluent in Swedish and English)
* Strong, successful pre-sales engineering track record in the industry and territory in a similar position is necessary
* A sound knowledge of fundamental networking technologies:
* Layer 2/3 switching
* IPv4/v6 routing concepts
* Overlay networking, VPNs
* Wi-Fi operation and design
* Network security principles
* Knowledge and practical experience in these areas are an advantage:
* Cloud technologies and Cloud-based network management platforms
* Compute and network virtualization principles
* Network management and orchestration software
* SD-WAN
* Automation scripting and APIs
* Ability to work as a part of customer project teams on design and PoC labs, setting criteria for successful PoCs, and overall solution designs
* Tenacity and perseverance (customer advocate facing internally to Extreme)
* Ability to build, develop, and maintain a network of people at the customer/partner side independent of sales being accepted as the trusted advisor
* When growing the business the willingness to assume a team-lead role for the account team when/if business requires additional resources.
* Experience working with partners is a plus for technical training on products.
* Major account experience and experience in closing deals is necessary.
* Extreme Networks certifications are desirable, but not mandatory
* Recognized industry certifications is a plus
* Ability to demonstrate knowledge and understanding of future trends and market directions
* Ability to support customer evaluations, demonstrations and detailed design requirements
* Good general hands-on lab experience is required


**About Extreme Networks**
 Extreme Networks is a global leader in cloud-managed networking solutions. We're committed to simplifying and securing the access network for organizations of all sizes. Our innovative technology and customer-centric approach have made us a trusted partner for 30,000+ customers worldwide.
   

 By harnessing the power of cloud computing, machine learning, and artificial intelligence, Extreme offers unparalleled simplicity and security for access networks. Our Cloud-Managed Wireless, Switching, Routing, and Security technologies provide unrivalled flexibility in deployment, management, and licensing. Working with pioneering Controller-less Wi-Fi and Cloud Management, Extreme delivers continuous innovation at Cloud-speed that constantly challenges the industry norm, allowing customers to rethink what’s possible.

title: 3PP SW Management
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 The world is changing, and so are we. The requirements on our handling of 3PP SW within Ericsson has increased substantial in recent years due to;
   

  

* Frequent 3PP SW update (to reduce vulnerabilities) is expected by customers and a best practice in many SW echo systems.
* Standards and regulations are coming, e.g. NIST and SSDF.


 We need to secure compliance to our legal requirements and Product Life Cycle Management rules and Guidance for Radio SW.
   

  

 If you are passionate about technology and ready to drive 3PP Management evolution we would really like you to join our team.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 Lead the evolution of data management of 3PP SW for Radio products, by:
   

  

* Drive and implement the automation of Radio 3PP SW handling.
* Cooperate in process and tools improvement work in 3PP SW related communities.
* Cooperate with Radio SW product and production architects to create an E2E flow of 3PP SW.
* Coordinate the 3PP SW activities and be the Radio SPOC for 3PP SW in governance boards and studies.
* Be responsible for the Radio SVL (Software vendor list) and support design and the release work with 3PP knowledge.


**The Skills You Bring**
* Master's degree or equivalent experience in a technical field.
* Over 10 years of experience in software development and R&D.
* Passionate about technology and solutions and experience in developing evolving technologies.
* Innovating, adapting, and responding to change.
* Thrives on accountability, overcoming challenges with a can-do attitude and motivated to achieve beyond expectations.
* Good knowledge of Linux as a platform for software development and deployment.
* Proficiency in scripting languages (Python, Bash, etc.) for automation.
* Experience and understanding in Build tools (Yocto), CI/CD/Jenkins and Configuration Management.
* Strong understanding in FOSS and COTS management tools (EVMS, SCAS, BDBA) and processes.
* Effective communication and fluent in English.
* Excellent technical leadership aligned with Ericsson's core values.


 If you’re ready to make an impact and lead the next phase of 3PP Management within Radio, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

**Application**
 Last day to apply is May 19, 2025. The position is based in Kista, Sweden. We are reviewing applications on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. Kindly note that we do not accept applications sent via e-mail.
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. title: Mätningsingenjör till huvudkontoret i Stockholm
company_industry: Civil Engineering, Architecture and Planning, and Environmental Services
description:
Vill du vara med och lyfta Sveriges ledande organisation av mättekniska specialister till nästa nivå? Samtidigt som du har en stor variation i dina uppdrag och goda förutsättningar för att växa med uppgiften? Då är Sweco arbetsplatsen för dig! Var med och forma framtidens mätningsteknik!
 



  





**Varför jobba hos oss?** 




 Vi är med våra
 **ca 225 medarbetare** 
 inom mätningsteknik
 **störst i Sverige** 
 på området. Vi är fördelade på 16 grupper och hela 20 olika kontor i landet och jobbar brett inom mätningsteknik med bland annat sjömätning, drönarflygning, projekteringsinmätning, mängdreglering, och inom MBK mot våra kommunala kunder.
 



  





 I vår grupp är vi 14 medarbetare, placerade i Stockholm och Katrineholm, som arbetar brett inom mätningsteknik. Vårt fokus är främst på den kommunala verksamheten och projekteringsinmätning. Vi samordnar även kommunens drönarverksamhet och bidrar kontinuerligt till kvalitetsförbättringsarbetet tillsammans med de kommuner vi samarbetar med. Här kommer du ha stor möjlighet att själv lägga upp ditt arbete utifrån kompetens och intresse.
 



  





 Hos Sweco blir du en
 **del av en gemenskap** 
 . I våra relationer till varandra och till våra kunder hittar vi styrkan, nyfikenheten och lösningarna att komma framåt – både i jobbet och i livet. Vi är en
 **flexibel arbetsplats** 
 för att du ska kunna styra dina dagar i största möjliga mån, genom ansvar, frihet och
 **stöttande kollegor** 
 . Hos oss är det viktigt att ha kul på jobbet! Du kommer att arbeta i nära samarbete både med dina lokala Sweco-kollegor och även med kollegor nationellt.
 



  





**Din framtida roll** 




 Som konsult inom mätningsteknik kommer du exempelvis att
 


* Ha ett stort ansvar för att leda det mättekniska arbetet och vara en aktiv del i planering av verksamheten i våra uppdrag.
* Arbeta med varierande uppdrag där vår fokus är främst uppdrag inom den kommunala verksamheten och projekteringsinmätningar.
* Hjälpa våra kunder med olika produkter för medborgare och beslutsfattare.
* Samordna och driva projektteam.
* Utveckla kundrelationer och på sikt sälja in egna uppdrag.
* Bidra till gruppens utveckling genom kompetensspridning och teknikutveckling.
* Vara delaktig i en stimulerande miljö med erfarna och kompetenta kollegor där det finns möjlighet att växa och utvecklas brett inom mätningsteknik.



  





 Hos oss kommer du att ha en nyckelroll som vi ser fram emot att forma tillsammans med dig utifrån dina tidigare erfarenheter och en gemensam vision att driva Swecos mätsida framåt.
 



 På Sweco strävar vi efter att alla medarbetare ska nå sin fulla potential. Ledarskapet på Sweco är därför en viktig del av din utveckling och bygger på balansen mellan utmaning och stöd. Genom att lära oss av misstag och vara öppna för förändring kan vi tillsammans framtidssäkra vår verksamhet och göra verklig skillnad för vårt samhälle. Vi strävar efter att finnas där för dig, så att du kan vara ditt bästa jag på jobbet och för våra kunder. Vill du vara med på vår resa?
 



  





**Den vi söker – är det du?** 




 Vi söker dig som har
 


* Relevant utbildning högskola/universitet/YH alternativt likvärdig erfarenhet förvärvad från yrkeslivet inom mätning- och kartteknik, GIS, lantmäteri eller annan relevant utbildning.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom relevant område
* God förmåga att uttrycka dig i svenska, både i tal och skrift.
* Giltigt B-körkort.



  





 Det är
 **meriterande** 
 om du har erfarenhet av
 


* Projekteringsinmätning
* Kommunal verksamhet
* Erfarenhet av samordning



  





 Du är intresserad av att själv utvecklas och att vara med och utveckla dina kollegor och kunder och du tycker om att skapa kontakter både externt och internt. På Sweco värdesätter vi ett gott affärsmässigt förhållningssätt då våra kontaktytor bygger på samarbete och goda relationer.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdatum. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mejl, utan hänvisar samtliga ansökningar till ansökningsformuläret nedan. Vi återkopplar till samtliga sökande efter avslutad rekryteringsprocess.
 



 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
 



  





**Kontakta oss** 




 Vill du höra mer om tjänsten och hur vi jobbar i gruppen? Välkommen att kontakta gruppchef Viviana Munoz på viviana.munoz@sweco.se.
 



 Vill du vara med och forma framtiden?
 



 Då ser vi fram emot din ansökan!

title: Senior Data Engineer – Stockholm
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Design Services
description:
Är du en erfaren Dataingenjör, BI-utvecklare/BI-konsult eller ETL-utvecklare som vill ta nästa steg i din karriär? Drömmer du om att arbeta med modern teknik och lösa komplexa problem tillsammans med ett nätverk av skickliga Data- och Analysexperter? Då kan du vara den vi söker!
   

  

 Våra närmare 100 dataexperter i Sverige jobbar med datalösningar inom nästan alla teknologier. Ett vanligt projekt varierar i längd från en månad till några år, och situationen kan justeras baserat på dina önskemål. Våra kunder finns inom alla branscher, allt från produktutveckling, hälsa, industri och försäkring till kommunikation, bank och elförsörjning.
   

  

**Möt en av våra Data Engineers:** 
 Clara Lundström arbetar i ett projekt för ett globalt företag inom facility service, det största i Norden. Tillsammans med sitt team illustrerar hon datalandskapet och använder data från olika källor för att skapa visualiseringar. Clara beskriver arbetet på Solita som varierat och utvecklande, med tillgång till ett stort nätverk av experter inom många olika områden.
   

  

**Vad Vi Erbjuder**
* En företagskultur som präglas av autonomi, stöd och gemensam tillväxt.
* Spännande kundprojekt och erfarna kollegor som är omtänksamma och passionerade.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med en stor bredd av projekt och branscher.
* Partnerskap med ledande tech-företag som GCP, AWS och Snowflake.


**Känner du igen dig i följande?**
 Som Data Engineer på Solita jobbar du brett; end-to-end från ingestion hela vägen till visualisering. Det är bra om du har erfarenhet inom; pipelines, ingestion, datawarehousing modellering, analys och visualisering. Exempel på tekniker vi arbetar med är Snowflake, Matillion, DBT, Databricks, Fabric, Data factory, Bigquery och mer! Vi jobbar även ofta i cloud och arbetar primärt i Python eller SQL. Som konsult på Solita är det viktigt att du kan kommunicera tekniska lösningar till kunder och hantera deras behov och problem. Du behärskar även svenska och engelska flytande.
   

  

**Dina Ansvarsområden i Rollen**
* Självständigt leverera komplexa uppdrag inom ditt expertområde och planera de bästa åtgärderna för att nå önskade resultat.
* Utveckla arbetsmetoder och processer samt vägleda och agera mentor till andra.
* Analysera nya problem, bedöma teknisk information och andra källor, samt utveckla nya lösningar.
* Optimera befintliga processer och delta i utvecklingen av nya processer av avdelningsövergripande betydelse.
* Leverera lösningar till kunder och samarbeta nära med dem för att förstå och möta deras behov.


 Det viktigaste för oss är ändå att du delar våra värderingar, du är omtänksam mot andra och delar gärna din kunskap och vågar stå för det du tror på. Vår företagskultur är väldigt viktig för oss, och vi värdesätter låg hierarki, självständighet och ansvar, värdeskapande arbete, och trevliga kollegor. Här kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, och här kan du bläddra bland våra tech-bloggar.
   

  

**En dag på Solita:** 
 Din dag kan börja med ett standup-möte med kund och team-medlemmar, följt av kodnära arbete som att bygga data pipelines och programmera i Python/SQL. Under dagen kan det dyka upp ad-hoc möten med kund eller kollegor, eller interna utbildningsmöten. Dagen avslutas ofta med mer kodarbete, möten och inte minst – fika!
   

  

**Våra förmåner**
 Hos Oss Får Du Inte Bara Trevliga Kollegor Utan Du Får Även Ta Del Av Ett Brett Förmånspaket. Här Är Några Utav Våra Förmåner
   

  

 💰 Fast lön, oberoende av beläggningsgrad
   

  

 🏖️ 30 semesterdagar
   

  

 ⚖️ Interna mentorskapsprogram
   

  

 🛋️ Möjligheter till flex för en god work-life-balance
   

  

 🪩 After Work och hobbyaktiviteter
   

  

 🔗 Intern coach för att stödja ditt välbefinnande
   

  

 🥐 Fredagsfrukost
   

  

**Intresserad?**
 Vid frågor; kontakta jacob.beck(at)solita.se eller ansök här. Du kan också connecta med Jacob på LinkedIn på https://www.linkedin.com/in/jacob-beck-/. Vi uppskattar dina färdigheter, men vi är också ivriga att lära oss om essensen i din motivation och hur du ser din tillväxt framför dig. Dela ditt CV nedan så återkommer vi så fort vi kan!

title: Senior Testautomatiserare
description:
*Vill du ta ditt konsultande till nästa nivå hos en av Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare? Vi vet vad du tänker. Du har hört det förut. Men tro oss, det har du inte. Vårt körsbär på konsulttårtan är något annat. Sök jobbet och smaka själv!* 




**Rollen** 




 Vi på Castra söker nu en Senior Testautomatiserare. Du kommer att ansvara för att utforma, implementera och optimera automatiserade testfall. Du kommer ha ett nära samarbete med mjukvaruutvecklingsteam för att säkerställa att produkterna uppfyller höga kvalitetsstandarder.
   





**Vi ser att du har:**



* Erfarenhet av design och implementering av automatiserade testfall med hjälp av testramverk som Selenium, Cypress eller liknande.
* Förmåga att förstå och översätta tekniska krav och användarfall till testscenarier.
* Erfarenhet av skriptning och programmering för att skapa testskript och testverktyg (Bash, Python eller  liknande).
* Erfarenhet av Integration av testautomation i CI/CD-pipelines för kontinuerlig testning.



 Låter detta som du? Skicka in ditt cv så kan vi diskutera närmare redan kommande vecka!
 



**Det bästa åt de bästa – vår personalfilosofi**




 Castra är en konsultgrupp inom IT och management. Eller ja, en elite squad kan man säga. Vi samlar de vassaste och mest erfarna konsulterna, helt enkelt för att det är hos oss de får ut max i både kapacitet och livskvalitet.
 



 Vi är en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser. Det låter lite skrytsamt, förlåt. Men det är faktiskt inte vi som sagt det. Castra har sedan 2017 blivit certifierad av Great Place to Work och har de senaste tre åren blivit utnämnda till en av Sveriges Bästa Arbetsplatser. Som grädde på moset är vi även Gasell- och Karriärföretag.
 



 På Castra tror vi på frihet, utveckling och gemenskap. Du som konsult styr själv vilka uppdrag du tar, när du jobbar, om du vill levla upp någon kompetens och hur och mycket lön och semester du tar ut. Att du får bygga din egen logga är bara ytterligare ett bevis. Trodde du det var allt? Då trodde du fel. Stöd av bra chefer, aktiviteter, kompetent och snabbfotad säljstyrka, möjlighet till delägarskap, stora möjligheter att påverka bolagets framtid och härliga kollegor – listan på vad som gör Castra till en fantastisk arbetsplats kan göras lååång. Summan av kardemumman är att hos oss är möjligheterna bra nära oändliga. Win för alla parter, säger vi.
 



*Castra har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Eskilstuna, Malmö, Linköping, Norrköping, Örebro och Jönköping.* 




 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss på castra.se/konsulterbjudande/
 



  

**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?** 




 Sök direkt via länken eller hör av dig till Charlotta på Charlotta.Ljung@castra.se eller 072 871 63 12
